page.title: 13CHANGING TIMES 1945-1985
page.content: Local History:Prewett's Mill was built in 1861. It was steam powered, not water. It was used for stone grinding flour for human consumption. The engine lasted until 1970. The millstones are made of French granite which had to be dressed every day. The mill was bought by United Rum Merchants in 1980.The building was redesigned by Christopher Hide. The alterations took 10 months costing Â£3 million. Only the outside shell remains of the original building. Provender Mill-built in 1861 as a one storey mill. There were originaly two wheels, one undershot, one overshot but they rotted away. Provender comes from saxon word meaning animal food. Abandoned in 1960, Mr. Paul Brand bought the mill in 1983 and found it in a terrible state. Now restored as private house with four storeys.
